## Introduction
After quality control (see 1_preprocessing) we integrate the 2 NotchCphRNAi replicates using Seurat. 

```{r}
options(warn = 1)

# read in the QCed sc experiment (see 1_preprocessing for creation)
NotchCphRNAi <- readRDS(here("output", "NotchCphRNAi_qced.rds"))

# From now on we will use Seurat. We will still remove the low quality
# cells that were removed during  (see 1_preprocessing)
sample_ids <- c("TX49_rep1", "TX49_rep2") # this is our internal ID
file_names <- c("DS-00248", "DS-00249")


NotchCphRNAi_split <- lapply(setNames(seq_along(file_names), sample_ids), function(index) {
    file <- file_names[index]
    sample <- sample_ids[index]
    print(sample)
    sce_tmp <- NotchCphRNAi[[sample]]
    tmp <- Read10X(data.dir = here("raw_data", "NotchCphRNAi", file, "raw_feature_bc_matrix"))

    # we already know which cells to remove because we have done the preprocessing before.
    # So remove them here:
    tmp <- tmp[, colnames(tmp) %in% sce_tmp$Barcode]

    seurat_o <- CreateSeuratObject(
        counts = tmp,
        project = sample,
        min.cells = 0,
        min.features = 0
    )

    seurat_o <- NormalizeData(seurat_o, normalization.method = "LogNormalize", scale.factor = 10000) %>%
        FindVariableFeatures(., selection.method = "vst", nfeatures = 3000) %>%
        ScaleData(.) %>%
        RunPCA(., npcs = 50, verbose = F) %>%
        RunUMAP(., reduction = "pca", dims = 1:20, verbose = F)


    # add some metadata about the number of detected cells and so on
    seurat_o@meta.data$Sample <- sce_tmp$Sample
    seurat_o@meta.data$Barcode <- sce_tmp$Barcode
    seurat_o@meta.data$sum <- sce_tmp$sum
    seurat_o@meta.data$detected <- sce_tmp$detected
    seurat_o@meta.data$Mito_pct <- sce_tmp$subsets_Mito_percent
    seurat_o@meta.data$Mito_sum <- sce_tmp$subsets_Mito_sum
    seurat_o@meta.data$Mito_detected <- sce_tmp$subsets_Mito_detected
    seurat_o@meta.data$sizeFactor <- sce_tmp$sizeFactor
    return(seurat_o)
})


# add the experiment to cellname
NotchCphRNAi_split <- lapply(setNames(names(NotchCphRNAi_split), names(NotchCphRNAi_split)), function(x) {
    tmp <- NotchCphRNAi_split[[x]]
    tmp <- RenameCells(tmp, add.cell.id = x)
})
```


## Integrate the 2 replicates
```{r}
features <- SelectIntegrationFeatures(object.list = NotchCphRNAi_split)

# find anchors between experiments
anchors <- FindIntegrationAnchors(
    object.list = NotchCphRNAi_split,
    anchor.features = features
)

NotchCphRNAi_integrated <- IntegrateData(anchorset = anchors, dims = 1:20)
DefaultAssay(NotchCphRNAi_integrated) <- "integrated"
NotchCphRNAi_integrated <- ScaleData(NotchCphRNAi_integrated) %>%
    RunPCA(., npcs = 50, verbose = F) %>%
    RunUMAP(., reduction = "pca", dims = 1:20, verbose = F, return.model = TRUE) %>%
    FindNeighbors(., dims = 1:20, k.param = 10, verbose = F) %>%
    FindClusters(.,
        resolution = c(0.3, 0.5, 0.7, 1, 1.3, 1.6)
    )
DefaultAssay(NotchCphRNAi_integrated) <- "RNA"
```


# Make some diagnostic plots
```{r}
p1 <- DimPlot(NotchCphRNAi_integrated, group.by = "orig.ident") +
    small_axis("UMAP") +
    ggtitle("Integrated")
p1


p2 <- FeaturePlot(NotchCphRNAi_integrated, "Mito_pct") + small_axis("UMAP ")
patchwork::wrap_plots(p1, p2)

# process the individual experiments again but regress out the mito effect
NotchCphRNAi_split_2 <- lapply(setNames(names(NotchCphRNAi_split), names(NotchCphRNAi_split)), function(x) {
    tmp <- NotchCphRNAi_split[[x]]
    tmp <- DietSeurat(tmp, data = T) %>%
        NormalizeData(., normalization.method = "LogNormalize", scale.factor = 10000) %>%
        FindVariableFeatures(., selection.method = "vst", nfeatures = 3000) %>%
        ScaleData(., vars.to.regress = "Mito_pct") %>%
        RunPCA(., npcs = 50, verbose = F) %>%
        RunUMAP(., reduction = "pca", dims = 1:20, verbose = F)
})
FeaturePlot(NotchCphRNAi_split_2$TX49_rep1, "Mito_pct", reduction = "umap")
FeaturePlot(NotchCphRNAi_split_2$TX49_rep2, "Mito_pct", reduction = "umap")


# Still replicates do not integrate... Clusters clearly according to mitochondrial content.
# We will only continue with the first replicate of NotchRNAi+CphRNAi condition
saveRDS(NotchCphRNAi_split$TX49_rep1, here("output", "NotchCphRNAi_seurat_TX49_rep1.rds"))
```
